title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 1, ch. I, subch. B, pt. 19 - General Provisions Relating To The New York - New Jersey Milk Marketing Area
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 1, ch. I, subch. B, pt. 19 - General Provisions Relating To The New York - New Jersey Milk Marketing Area

State Regulations
§ 19.1 - Scope and purpose
§ 19.2 - Definitions
§ 19.3 - Market administrator
§ 19.4 - Continuity and separability of provisions
§ 19.5 - Handler responsibility for records and facilities
§ 19.6 - Termination of obligations

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 1, ch. I, subch. B, pt. 19

Statutory authority: Agriculture and Markets Law, §258-n

The provisions of this Part are issued jointly and
concurrently with the provisions of Part 1000 promulgated by the Secretary of

Agriculture of the United States also relating to the New York - New Jersey
milk marketing area. Such Parts shall be jointly administered and shall have
uniform application to Federal Order No. 2 and New York State Official Order

No. 126 (1 NYCRR Part
20
) each regulating the handling of milk in the New York
- New Jersey milk marketing area. State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
